property.name: yarn.app.mapreduce.am.env
property.description: User added environment variables for the MR App Master processes. Example : 1) A=foo This will set the env variable A to foo 2) B=$B:c This is inherit tasktracker's B env variable.

property.name: mapred.child.env
property.description: User added environment variables for the task processes. Example : 1) A=foo This will set the env variable A to foo 2) B=$B:c This is inherit nodemanager's B env variable on Unix. 3) B=%B%;c This is inherit nodemanager's B env variable on Windows.

property.name: mapreduce.task.io.sort.factor
property.description: The number of streams to merge at once while sorting files. This determines the number of open file handles.

property.name: mapreduce.task.io.sort.mb
property.description: The total amount of buffer memory to use while sorting files, in megabytes. By default, gives each merge stream 1MB, which should minimize seeks.

property.name: mapreduce.cluster.local.dir
property.description: The local directory where MapReduce stores intermediate data files. May be a comma-separated list of directories on different devices in order to spread disk i/o. Directories that do not exist are ignored.

property.name: mapreduce.jobtracker.system.dir
property.description: The directory where MapReduce stores control files.

property.name: mapreduce.jobtracker.staging.root.dir
property.description: The root of the staging area for users' job files In practice, this should be the directory where users' home directories are located (usually /user)

property.name: mapreduce.cluster.temp.dir
property.description: A shared directory for temporary files.

property.name: mapreduce.reduce.shuffle.parallelcopies
property.description: The default number of parallel transfers run by reduce during the copy(shuffle) phase.

property.name: mapred.child.java.opts
property.description:
Java opts for the task tracker child processes. The following symbol, if present, will be interpolated: @taskid@ is replaced by current TaskID. Any other occurrences of '@' will go unchanged. For example, to enable verbose gc logging to a file named for the taskid in /tmp and to set the heap maximum to be a gigabyte, pass a 'value' of: -Xmx2560m -verbose:gc -Xloggc:/tmp/@taskid@.gc
Usage of -Djava.library.path can cause programs to no longer function if hadoop native libraries are used. These values should instead be set as part of LD_LIBRARY_PATH in the map / reduce JVM env using the mapreduce.map.env and mapreduce.reduce.env config settings.

property.name: mapreduce.job.maps
property.description: The default number of map tasks per job. Ignored when mapreduce.jobtracker.address is "local".

property.name: mapreduce.map.cpu.vcores
property.description: The number of virtual cores to request from the scheduler for each map task.

property.name: mapreduce.reduce.cpu.vcores
property.description: The number of virtual cores to request from the scheduler for each reduce task.

property.name: mapreduce.job.reduces
property.description: The default number of reduce tasks per job. Typically set to 99% of the cluster's reduce capacity, so that if a node fails the reduces can still be executed in a single wave. Ignored when mapreduce.jobtracker.address is "local".

property.name: mapreduce.job.reduce.slowstart.completedmaps
property.description: Fraction of the number of maps in the job which should be complete before reduces are scheduled for the job.

property.name: mapreduce.task.tmp.dir
property.description: To set the value of tmp directory for map and reduce tasks. If the value is an absolute path, it is directly assigned. Otherwise, it is prepended with task's working directory. The java tasks are executed with option -Djava.io.tmpdir='the absolute path of the tmp dir'. Pipes and streaming are set with environment variable, TMPDIR='the absolute path of the tmp dir'

property.name: mapreduce.framework.name
property.description: The runtime framework for executing MapReduce jobs. Can be one of local, classic or yarn.

property.name: mapreduce.jobtracker.handler.count
property.description: The number of server threads for the JobTracker. This should be roughly 4% of the number of tasktracker nodes.

property.name: mapreduce.tasktracker.http.threads
property.description: The number of worker threads that for the http server. This is used for map output fetching

property.name: yarn.app.mapreduce.am.staging-dir
property.description: The staging dir used while submitting jobs.

property.name: yarn.app.mapreduce.am.command-opts
property.description:
Java opts for the MR App Master processes. The following symbol, if present, will be interpolated: @taskid@ is replaced by current TaskID. Any other occurrences of '@' will go unchanged. For example, to enable verbose gc logging to a file named for the taskid in /tmp and to set the heap maximum to be a gigabyte, pass a 'value' of: -Xmx1024m -verbose:gc -Xloggc:/tmp/@taskid@.gc
Usage of -Djava.library.path can cause programs to no longer function if hadoop native libraries are used. These values should instead be set as part of LD_LIBRARY_PATH in the map / reduce JVM env using the mapreduce.map.env and mapreduce.reduce.env config settings.

property.name: mapreduce.output.fileoutputformat.compress
property.description: Should the job outputs be compressed?

property.name: mapreduce.map.output.compress
property.description: Should the outputs of the maps be compressed before being sent across the network. Uses SequenceFile compression.

property.name: mapreduce.jobtracker.hosts.filename
property.description: Names a file that contains the list of nodes that may connect to the jobtracker. If the value is empty, all hosts are permitted.

property.name: mapreduce.jobtracker.hosts.exclude.filename
property.description: Names a file that contains the list of hosts that should be excluded by the jobtracker. If the value is empty, no hosts are excluded.

property.name: mapreduce.map.speculative
property.description: If true, then multiple instances of some map tasks may be executed in parallel.

property.name: mapreduce.reduce.speculative
property.description: If true, then multiple instances of some reduce tasks may be executed in parallel.

property.name: mapreduce.jobhistory.address
property.description: MapReduce JobHistory Server IPC host:port

property.name: mapreduce.jobhistory.webapp.address
property.description: MapReduce JobHistory Server Web UI host:port

property.name: mapreduce.client.submit.file.replication
property.description: The replication level for submitted job files. This should be around the square root of the number of nodes.
